required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: First-in-Human Study of the GDF-15 Neutralizing Antibody CTL-002 in Patients With Advanced Cancer (GDFATHER)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, First-in-human (FIH), Two-part, Open-label Clinical Trial of Intravenous (IV) Administration of CTL-002 Given as Monotherapy and/or in Combination With an Anti-PD-1 Checkpoint Inhibitor in Subjects With Advanced-stage, Relapsed/Refractory Solid Tumors, That Relapsed Post or Were Refractory to a Prior Anti-PD-1/PD-L1 Therapy and Have Exhausted All Available Approved Standard Treatments or Are Not Eligible for Them Anymore (the "GDFATHER"-Trial: GDF-15 Antibody-mediaTed Effector Cell Relocation).

brief_summary.textblock: Part A will be a dose escalation study of IV CTL002 (a monoclonal antibody neutralizing GDF-15) as monotherapy and in combination with an approved checkpoint inhibitor (CPI) in patients with advanced solid tumors. Part B will be a cohort expansion into up to five solid tumor indications.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Patients will be assigned to a dose level of CTL-002 at the time of their enrollment

primary_outcome.description: Incidence of treatment emergent adverse events in monotherapy and/or combination therapy

primary_outcome.measure: Determination of DLT and MTD (Part A)
primary_outcome.description: Assessment of toxicities in monotherapy and/or combination therapy per dose level

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of clinical efficacy according RECIST (Part B)
primary_outcome.description: RECIST is measured every 6-8 weeks treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Cmax following the first dose of CTL-002 (Part A & B)
secondary_outcome.description: PK parameter from serum CTL-002 levels

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC following the first dose of CTL-002 (Part A & B)
secondary_outcome.description: PK parameter from serum CTL-002 levels
PK parameter from serum CTL-002 levels

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of treatment-emergent cytokine/chemokine concentrations (including TNF-a, IFN-g, IL-2, CXCL-9 and CXCL-10) (Part A & B)
secondary_outcome.description: Measurement of concentration in peripheral blood

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of clinical efficacy according RECIST (Part A)
secondary_outcome.description: RECIST is measured every 6-8 weeks during treatment
Assessment of appetite via quality of life questionnaire
Calculation of BMI in kg/m2 by combining measurement of body weight in kg and body height in cm

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of lumbar vertebra skeletal muscle index (L3SMI) (cm2/m2)
secondary_outcome.description: Combining measurement of L3 vertebra skeletal muscle mass via computed tomography (CT) in cm2 and patient height (squared) in m2

arm_group.arm_group_label: Part A: CTL-002 Monotherapy + Checkpoint Inhibitor Combination Dose Escalation
arm_group.description: Up to five dose levels with CTL-002 administered as IV monotherapy and in combination with an checkpoint inhibitor

arm_group.arm_group_label: Part B: CTL-002 Monotherapy + Checkpoint Inhibitor combination
arm_group.description: Up to 2 dose levels with CTL-002 in Part B (expansion)

intervention.arm_group_label: Part A: CTL-002 Monotherapy + Checkpoint Inhibitor Combination Dose Escalation
Part B: CTL-002 Monotherapy + Checkpoint Inhibitor combination

criteria.textblock:
Main Inclusion Criteria:
- Signed and dated informed consent, and able to comply with the study procedures and any locally required authorization.
- Male or female aged â‰¥ 18 years.
- Relapsed/refractory patients with histologically or cytologically confirmed diagnosis of advanced-stage or recurrent cancer
- Progressed on/relapsed after at least one prior anti-PD-1/PD-L1 treatment
- Biopsy-accessible tumor lesions and willing to undergo triple sequential tumor biopsy (Part A).
- At least 1 radiologically measurable lesion per RECIST V1.1/imRECIST (Part B).
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status 0-1.
- Life expectancy > 3 months as assessed by the Investigator.
- Adequate organ function (bone marrow, hepatic, renal function and coagulation).
Main Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant or breastfeeding.
- Any tumor-directed therapy within 21 days before study treatment.
- Treatment with investigational agent within 21 days before study treatment.
- Radiotherapy within 14 days before study treatment.
- Pre-existing arrhythmia, uncontrolled angina pectoris, uncontrolled heart failure (NYHA II-IV), any myocardial infarction/coronary event, CNS-ischemic event and any thromboembolic event at any time < 6 months prior to Screening.
- Left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) < 50% measured by echocardiogram or MUGA.
- QTcF > 450 ms for men or > 470 ms for women.
- Any active autoimmune requiring systemic immunosuppressive treatments. .
- Any history of non-infectious pneumonitis < 6 months prior to Screening.
- Any active inflammatory bowel disease such as Crohn's disease or ulcerative colitis which are generally excluded or active autoimmunthyroiditis present < 6 months prior to Screening.
- History of CNS disease such as stroke, seizure, encephalitis, or multiple sclerosis (< 6 months prior to Screening).
